p: In the present investigation, the dosage of 80ppm was sufficient to cause 100% larval mortality against the larvae of both species after 24h. Similarly, the toxicity of T. orientalis and Chamaecyparis obtusa oils were tested against 4 th-instar larvae of Aedes aegypti and Cx. pipiens after 24h and they reported 100% larval mortality when treated with 400ppm of both oils ( 23).
